steps.title: Welcome to C Major!
steps.description: The C major scale uses only the white keys on the piano: C, D, E, F, G, A, B. It's the most fundamental scale in Western music and the perfect place to start learning.

steps.title: Find Middle C
steps.description: Press the C key on the piano. Middle C is MIDI note 60.
steps.hint: Look for the white key just left of the group of two black keys.

steps.title: Play C and E
steps.description: Now play both C and E together.
steps.hint: E is two white keys to the right of C.

steps.title: Play the C Major Scale
steps.description: Play all 8 notes of the C major scale ascending: C, D, E, F, G, A, B, C.
steps.hint: Play the white keys from C to the next C, one at a time.

steps.title: Play a C Major Chord
steps.description: Play C, E, and G together to form the C major chord.
steps.hint: Press C (60), E (64), and G (67) at the same time.
